intro: Syncolostemon heterophyllus, commonly known as the variable-leaf synoclostemon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, ranging from ovate to lanceolate, and its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
